source_sentence: 諸佛集會陀羅尼經一卷
translation: Dhāraṇī of the Assembly of the Buddhas, One volume

source_sentence: 唐三藏法師提雲般若等奉　制譯
translation: translated by the Tang Tripiṭaka Master Ti Yun Prajñāpāramitā and others
Thus have I heard.
One time, the Buddha was at the edge of the Ganges River.
They're surrounded by the world-protecting four heavenly kings.

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告毘沙門等四天王言。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the Vaiśravaṇa and other four heavenly kings, saying.
You should know that all sentient beings.
Whether it's a man or woman, whether old or young.
They're all tethered by the four kinds of great fear.
It's birth, old age, illness, and death.

source_sentence: 然於其中死怖一種最難除遣。
translation: However, among them, the fear of death is the most difficult to remove.
Now, I'll explain the method of removing rejecting for you.
It was then that the four heavenly kings rose from their seats.
They joined their palms in respect and said to the Buddha.

source_sentence: 世尊我等今者獲大善利。
translation: Bhagavān, we've now attained great good fortune.

source_sentence: 得值如來攝受世間施其命故。
translation: It's because he meets the Tathāgata who takes in the world and bestows his life.
It was then that the Bhagavān rose from his seat.
To the east, he snapped his fingers and called out.

source_sentence: 彼方所有諸佛如來應正等覺。
translation: All the buddhas and tathāgatas in that place should be perfectly enlightened.
None of them are for all sentient beings.

source_sentence: 而成阿耨多羅三藐三菩提。
translation: He'll attain unsurpassed, correct, and complete enlightenment.

source_sentence: 諸佛當知我今為欲哀愍救護諸眾生故。
translation: The buddhas should know that now I want to have compassion and rescue sentient beings.
He turns the second wheel of the Dharma before he turns it.

source_sentence: 當令眾生色力壽命皆悉增長。
translation: It will cause sentient beings' form, strength, and longevity to all increase.
There's never again a time of untimely death.
Please let the buddhas come to this assembly.

source_sentence: 為護眾生共以威神除其橫苦。
translation: To protect sentient beings, they all use their authority to remove their unwholesome suffering.

source_sentence: 南西北方四維上下皆亦如是。
translation: So it is with the south, west, north, four directions, and up and down in the same way.

source_sentence: 是時如來以佛眼觀十方世界。
translation: The Tathāgata then observed the worlds in the ten directions with the Buddha's eye.
Each world has its own buddhas.
The side塞 fills it up like rice and hemp.
They all came to this assembly and became equal companions.
Still, he sees all the worlds in the ten directions.

source_sentence: 一一方處諸佛世尊亦皆遍滿分明顯現。
translation: In one direction, the buddhas and world-honored ones are also pervasively manifested.
Thus, all the buddha-tathāgatas are like this.
They all simultaneously raised their voices and spoke the mantra, saying.

source_sentence: 一一皆有金剛密跡王親近圍繞。
translation: Each one is surrounded by the vajra-mysterious traces of the king who's intimate with them.
These are the innumerable vajra kings.
Again, they spoke the mantra together in unison, saying.

source_sentence: [貝*甘](呼濫反引聲句一)[貝*甘](句二)室勢(句三)颯婆(去)訶(句四)爾時毘沙門天王白佛言世尊。
translation: [貝*甘](呼濫反引聲句一)[貝*甘](句二)室勢(句三)颯婆(去)訶(句四)爾時毘沙門天王白佛言世尊。

source_sentence: 我今亦為擁護眾生說陀羅尼。
translation: Now, I'll also explain the dhāraṇī for protecting sentient beings.
It causes them to die without existence and at an ungodly hour.
May the Tathāgata have mercy on us and give us his power.
He then explained the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 稅低(句一)稅怛犁(句二)履梨(句三)爾時毘盧勒叉天王亦作是言。
translation: The tax is low ( sentence 1), the tax is coarse ( sentence 2), and the treasury ( sentence 3). At that point, King Vairocana also said this.

source_sentence: 我今為欲護諸眾生說陀羅尼。
translation: Now, I'll explain the dhāraṇī for the sake of protecting sentient beings.
He then explained the dhāraṇī, saying.

source_sentence: 摩蹬耆(瞿雞反句一)摩蹬耆(祇里反)尼(儞咨反句二)暑(輸矩反下同)摩暑母(句三)爾時提頭賴吒天王。
translation: (Skt. mātṛkā (gṛdhrakūṭa) (1) mātṛkā (gṛdhrakūṭa) (2) mohatṛkā (gṛdhrakūṭa)nīya (gṛdhrakūṭa) (2) mohatṛkṣa mother (gṛdhrakūṭa) (3) At that point, the celestial king Tiṣurāṣṭa

source_sentence: 亦為擁護諸眾生故而說呪曰。
translation: It's also for the sake of protecting sentient beings that he says this dhāraṇī.
Cakravāḍa-cakravāḍa (go) ha

source_sentence: 爾時毘樓博叉天王亦說呪曰。
translation: It was then that the heavenly king Virūpākṣa also spoke a spell, saying.
(Skt. pārijātaka(go)va(above)va

source_sentence: 爾時世尊告四天王言諸天等此陀羅尼。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān addressed the four heavenly kings, saying, These are the dhāraṇīs of gods and so forth.
It's produced from all the buddhas.
All buddhas share the same knowing and seeing.
Suppose there are good men and good women.

source_sentence: 乃至有能一日之中讀一遍者。
translation: Even if there's someone who can recite it once in a day.
That person will never fall into a bad destiny.
That person then gives rise to the idea of a great teacher.

source_sentence: 若有人為欲利益一切眾生。
translation: Suppose there's a person who wants to benefit all sentient beings.
Every day, he recites this dhāraṇī.
It can cause sentient beings to grow in longevity.

source_sentence: 亦令其人災橫怖畏皆得消除。
translation: It will also cause those people to be freed from all their disasters and fears.
They don't have bad appearances or the suffering of illness.
Water can't float, and fire can't burn it.
A sword can't harm it, and poison can't harm it.

source_sentence: 若在在處處有能讀誦此陀羅尼。
translation: If there's someone everywhere who can recite this dhāraṇī.

source_sentence: 當知此處則為十方一切諸佛常所護念。
translation: You should know that this place is always guarded by all the buddhas of the ten directions.
Suppose someone writes for themselves or teaches others to write.

source_sentence: 其人則為承事供養一切諸佛。
translation: That person then serves and makes offerings to all the buddhas.
Why is it so?
If he's able to work for the benefit of sentient beings.
It's because they make offerings to all the buddhas.
If someone exclusively wants to embrace their body, then they'll be disciplined.
You should write this spell on your body.

source_sentence: 若所在之處有深信法善男子善女人等。
translation: If there are good men and good women who deeply believe in the Dharma wherever they are located.
Or they may encounter disasters and difficulties and want to be rid of them.
You should quickly accept and uphold this dhāraṇī according to the teaching.
He holds the dhāraṇī spell and attaches it to the Dharma.
First, he should briefly choose the pure place.
He rubs it on the ground with sandalwood powder.
It's one side of the altar, seven feet long and seven feet wide.
That person should start on the eighth day of the first month.

source_sentence: 香湯洗浴著新淨衣受八戒齋。
translation: He washes, bathes in scented hot water, puts on fresh and clean clothing, and observes the eight precepts.
They only eat millet, rice, rock honey, and cow milk.
He takes the fragrance of black shen and the fragrance of dragon head.
Together, they fill it with one or two and place it on the altar.
They also take white sandalwood incense or the scent of boiling water.

source_sentence: 或龍腦香或復丁香迦矩羅香。
translation: It's either the fragrance of dragon head or the fragrance of cakra.
He placed it on the altar.
That person recites this dhāraṇī spell.
He spells these fragrances.

source_sentence: 於日日中皆七七遍滿于七日。
translation: Every day, it's seventy-seven times every day for a full seven days.

source_sentence: 至十五日一日不食其日中時。
translation: On the fifteenth day, he won't eat for a day during the middle of the day.

source_sentence: 以欝金香於其壇上作二十一小壇。
translation: On top of that altar, he makes twenty-one small altar pieces with a scented gold incense stick.
In one place, it's called the Tathāgata altar.
The other twenty altars are called the vajra king altar.
Outside the altar, he also makes four smaller altar forms.

source_sentence: 名四天王壇復取麝香龍腦白檀欝金之香及紫檀末。
translation: It's called the altar of the four heavenly kings, and it's also made of musk odor, dragon hair, white sandalwood, gold, and purple sandalwood powder.

source_sentence: 於如來壇若散若塗而為供養。
translation: He makes offerings to the Tathāgata's altar either scattered or coated.

source_sentence: 自餘諸壇隨取一香而供養之。
translation: The rest of the altar takes a single fragrance and makes offerings to it.
He also takes milk, curds, butter, and sugar.
In order, he takes the new vase and puts it in four ways.

source_sentence: 各別盛之置四天王壇上。
translation: Each one is placed separately on top of the four heavenly kings' altar.
Again, he puts pure water inside the vial.

source_sentence: 採十二種果樹之花而置其中。
translation: He gathered twelve kinds of fruit-bearing trees and placed them there.

source_sentence: 又以香油然十支燈置如來壇。
translation: He also placed the ten kinds of lamps incense and oil on the Tathāgata's altar.
It's because they want to make offerings to the buddhas of the ten directions.
Each of the other altars has one altar.
Within the fragrance of the previous dhāraṇī's incense, he says.
He takes the dragon's head and sinking water.
At the Tathāgata's altar, he burns it and makes offerings.
The rest of the altar is filled with its own remaining fragrance.

source_sentence: 將然香時其如來壇及餘壇香。
translation: When it's about to be perfumed, the Tathāgata's altar and the other altar are perfumed.

source_sentence: 復應各別誦此神呪而以呪之。
translation: Each should also recite this dhāraṇī separately and use it as a dhāraṇī.
Suppose there are sentient beings who hear this fragrance.
When it's not the right time, he'll die and nothing will be removed.
The incense he had previously burned will be burned up.

source_sentence: 然後收彼四天王食散於淨處。
translation: He then collected the food of those four heavenly kings and scattered it in a pure place.
After the Buddha taught this sūtra, he said.

source_sentence: 四大天王及一切世間天人阿修羅乾闥婆等。
translation: The four great celestial kings, all the worldly gods, humans, asuras, gandharvas, and so forth.
They rejoice and venerate it.
Dhāraṇī of the Assembly of the Buddhas
